title: Enate 2013 Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Tomato and plum aromas are savory and spicy, with raw oak notes that don't shy away. This blend of Cabernet and Tempranillo feels crisp, dry, exact and tight. Flavors of foresty berry fruits are herbal and spicy, while this feels firm across the finish.

title: Eradus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)
description: Tomato leaf features on the nose and palate of this wine, a characteristic of the Awatere Valley (a subregion of Marlborough). Gooseberries provide a fruity base to this medium-bodied wine, but fade quickly on the finish.

title: Estandon 2016 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This is a refreshingly fruity wine with a fine balance between acidity and ripe red-currant and raspberry fruits. The wine is crisp, clean and full of fruitiness with a bright fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Filippi 2014 Vigne del Brà  (Soave Colli Scaligeri)
description: Pressed Spanish broom, citrus zest and almond aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the lively palate, a lemon drop hint accents pink grapefruit and yellow apple notes. It's vibrant, with racy acidity.

title: Fox Run 2014 Kaiser Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)
description: Dark toast and savory dried herbs persist from nose to finish on this barrel-fermented barrel-aged Chardonnay. Zesty lemon and green-apple notes on the midpalate are delicate in concentration but elegant and refreshing.

title: Luigi Bosca 2014 Finca La Linda Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: The old-vines Linda vineyard Malbec is a particular wine, one that shows a high herbal, almost weedy nose that's heavy with tomato leaf. This is choppy and bumpy on the palate. Spicy red-berry and tomato flavors finish with pulling tannins and a lasting herbal character.

title: Mastroberardino 2015 Neroametà Aglianico (Campania)
description: Subdued orchard fruit and white flower aromas lead the nose while the somewhat lean palate offers crisp red apple, crushed stone and chestnut notes. Zesty acidity gives it a fresh finish.

title: Mercer 2014 Reserve Spice Cabinet Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Barrel notes of vanilla, baking spice and dill are at the fore, with dark fruit lurking in the background. The palate brings lingering creamy-feeling fruit and barrel flavors. It provides appeal but the oak seems too forward.

title: Millbrook 2014 Block Two West Chardonnay (Hudson River Region)
description: This bold densely structured Chardonnay suggests notes of candied orange peel, preserved apple and pears accented with caramel and sweet spice. Delicate acidity accentuates a warm spicy finish.

title: Masseria Altemura 2016 Rosato (Salento)
description: Made from Negroamaro, this opens with aromas of red berry, apple and a whiff of wild flower. It's bright and refreshing, offering raspberry notes and a hint of white pepper alongside crisp acidity.

title: Rioja Vega 2015 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: This Tempranillo looks and smells ripe, and it's loaded with toasty minty oak aromas. In the mouth, this woody number is pushy and tannic. Barrel-driven flavors of smoky charred black plum are one-dimensional. This finishes tannic and with pounding oak.

title: Rippon 2014 Gewürztraminer (Central Otago)
description: In almost any other producer's lineup, this would be deemed a success, but in the context of Rippon's exalted reputation, this is a bit of a disappointment. Ripe pear, melon and citrus flavors are off dry and marked by floral notes, finishing clean and mouthwatering, but don't have much of the expected complexity.

title: Oyster Bay 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Any winemaker will tell you how difficult it is to make Pinot Noir in large volumes, so this is a notable achievement. Delicate herb and cherry aromas pick up vanilla shadings on the palate, then finish with a silky texture and a hint of tomato leaf. 10,000 cases imported.

title: Rosenhof 2015 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: A hint of reduction obfuscates this wine's nose. With a little air, it begins to show some of its red plum and red cherry notes. The palate is smooth, fresh and generous with fruit. Make sure to let it breathe.

title: Shaw 2014 Vin Rustique White (Finger Lakes)
description: A full year of maceration on the skins has transformed primary fruit flavors into a kaleidoscope of savory tea leaf, bramble and earth tones here. This is a curious, deeply complex wine augmented by bold tannins and bristling acidity. Dry in style, it has a firm savory finish.

title: Perla del Garda 2016 Bio  (Lugana)
description: This opens with banana, exotic fruit and honeysuckle aromas while the fruity palate offers white peach, green apple and candied tangerine flavors. A hint of white almond marks the close.

title: Perla del Garda 2016 Perla  (Lugana)
description: Jasmine, tropical fruit and yellow stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the rounded palate, tangy acidity accompanies banana, white peach and citrus flavors.

title: Mussel Bay 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a bit Sancerre-ish in its light to medium body, aromas of struck flint and crisp flavors of grapefruit. Riper hints of fig and melon betray its New World origins, but it still finishes tart and racy.

title: Villa Nissarda 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This soft and red-fruit-driven wine has attractive acidity and a crisp aftertaste. It is dry, all about bright raspberries and red currants. The aftertaste just carries on with fruit. Drink now.

title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Generic but pleasant berry aromas are a touch powdery and dusty. This feels medium to full in body. Dry spice notes are intermixed with generic berry flavors prior to a slightly oaky, lightly minty finish.

title: Santa Julia 2016 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Lightly herbal berry and plum aromas are uncomplicated. A medium-full palate tastes of generic berry fruits and plum. Rubbery tannins make for a tight drawing finish.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This bottling from the Dwarf Oak Vineyard offers pear, struck flint and smoked nut aromas, with the slightest hint of tropicality. The palate is rich with melted butter and roasted macadamia nut flavors—due, perhaps, to the warmer valley climate.

title: Schiopetto 2015 Friulano (Collio)
description: Alluring graphite, apricot and flint aromas jump out of the glass, but the rounded palate is less expressive, evoking mature yellow peach, dried herb and grapefruit. A bitter, nutty note marks the close.

title: William Marie 2015 Windmill Firethorn Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: High-toned aromas of barrel spice, green pepper, cherry and herb lead to plump cherry flavors. It delivers enjoyment but seems a bit generic.

title: Lawer 2013 Betsy's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Knights Valley)
description: Dull and reduced on the nose, this wine grows earthy and hearty in the glass as it opens, offering a mix of leather, black pepper, coffee and baked plum flavors.

title: Le Charmel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced close to the sea at Bandol, this wine has a good proportion (20%) of Mourvèdre in the blend. That adds to the richness and brings out a fine aromatic floral character. Wild strawberries flavors give a rich ready-to-drink aftertaste.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Merlot (Finger Lakes)
description: Long maturation in French oak lends a distinctly nutty, smoky tone to this brambly berried Merlot. While bold in body and a touch warm in alcohol, its ripe black-fruit flavors are sharpened by cranberry acidity and firm, penetrating tannins. A hint of cocoa powder lingers on the finish.

title: La Rajade 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Delicate varietal aromas including elderflower, grapefruit and tomato vine follow over to the bright, linear palate. A hint of graphite lends interest to the crisp finish.

title: Laird 2013 Jillian's Blend Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Syrah and smaller amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot shows prominent black cherry, cedar and licorice flavors, along with a streak of tobacco. Full bodied and moderate in acidity, it finishes simply.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2015 Red Oak Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Pristine lime zest and lemon notes add lift to rounded apple and nectarine flavors on the palate of this full-bodied richly textured Riesling. There's a weightiness on the midpalate but the finish is refreshing and crisp.
